moduleTitle: Music of the Church and State
moduleDescription: A study of music produced in religious and political settings, with an emphasis on music of the European Baroque tradition. The course explores issues of patronage, audience reception and performance, both in Baroque Europe and modern Singapore and SE Asia. Students will investigate and analyse musical genres and styles, and the religious beliefs, political ideology and artistic movements which form their context. (Non-Conservatory students that can read music may take this course as a free elective.)
faculty: YONG SIEW TOH CONSERVATORY OF MUSIC
department: YONG SIEW TOH CONSERVATORY OF MUSIC
